David and Richard have both given outstanding arguments supporting their judgments.  Any other opinions or arguments?

Jim




  I should follow Rich's example, and explain my reasoning.  The obvious choices are Kanayama & Owari.  The melted iron surface, small size, & tekotsu in the rim all argue for Kanayama, and similar tsuba are often found just so classified.  But Kanayama tsuba are more prone to difficult to identify motifs than Owari, and none of the characteristics here exclude Owari.  So I thought it better to bet on the dark horse choice.
